channel.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
channel.description: Well, I am attempting to add all the God Wars Bosses. Whenever I go to NPC.config and add the NPC's ID code from the client-side class.5 I get an error after I compile and run. I do not get the error when I compile, only after I run. [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 3870 at NPCHandler.loadNPCList(NPCHandler.java:2126) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:551) at server.main(server.java:111) [/code] I'm not sure what I have done wrong, so any help is appreciated. -David7147(AKA Seth)

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

Oh-Noes:

Do any of your other class5 codes work? I don’t mean the godwars ones you’ve just tried to add recently, but something that has worked since a while ago consistently.

Well, the bandos god was already added and it still works fine

Read full topic

item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

Oh-Noes:

You are compiling the client, right? Not just the server. I know it might seem like a dumb question, but I really don’t see why it doesn’t work for you

Naw it’s ok, and yeah I’m compiling BOTH

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

[quote=“Oh-Noes, post:32, topic:342287”]So what happens when you spawn that ID? If you right-click it, does the old name and level show up, or the changed ones? Like I said before, if the old one’s are still displayed, the client hasn’t changed anything (something is wrong).
Your compiler works fine doesn’t it?[/quote]
No no, when I spawn that npc the old npc shows up, I compile, I run, I compile I run, I spawn, same old npc, same name, same level, nothing has changed

Read full topic

So what happens when you spawn that ID? If you right-click it, does the old name and level show up, or the changed ones? Like I said before, if the old one’s are still displayed, the client hasn’t changed anything (something is wrong).
Your compiler works fine doesn’t it?

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

This is mine:

}
if(i == 433) {
   aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
   class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60);
   class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
   class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack";
   class5.anIntArray94 = new int[5];
   int changedColors = 1;
   class5.anInt91 = 110;
   class5.anInt86 = 110;
   class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors];
   class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors];
   class5.anIntArray94[0] = 9032; 
   class5.anIntArray94[1] = 9033;
   class5.anIntArray94[2] = 9034;
   class5.anIntArray94[3] = 9035;
   class5.anIntArray94[4] = 9036;
   class5.aString65 = "K'ril Tsutsaroth";
   class5.anInt61 = 650;
   class5.aByteArray89 = "The mighty lord Zamorakian's general K'ril Tsutsaroth!".getBytes(); 
}

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

There must be something you’re doing wrong client-sided. I know that ID works fine (see test image).

Your class5 code should be something alone the lines of:

if(i == 431) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.aByte68 = 5; //Size class5.anInt77 = 6943; //Stand anim class5.anInt67 = 6942; //Walk anim class5.anInt58 = 6942; //Walkback anim class5.anInt83 = 6942; //Walk left anim class5.anInt55 = 6942; //walk right anim class5.anIntArray94 = new int[5]; //Number of changed models class5.anIntArray94[0] = 10482; class5.anIntArray94[1] = 10483; class5.anIntArray94[2] = 10484; class5.anIntArray94[3] = 10485; class5.anIntArray94[4] = 10486; class5.aString65 = "K'ril Tsutsaroth"; class5.anInt61 = 650; //Combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "A servant of the god Zamorak.".getBytes(); }

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

Oh-Noes:

There must be something you missed - if the NPC’s name is still showing up as “Troll spectator”, then the client hasn’t changed anything at all… Make sure the class5 code has altered all the right things, the models used, the name, combat level, etc…

It’s not that its name is showing up as Troll Spectator, it’s the Troll Spectator. Like when I do ::npc 1118 I get the troll spectator, not my NPC with a different name

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Side adding NPC's[EDITED]AGAIN
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

Oh-Noes:

Then you did something wrong client-sided. Are you sure you spawned the same ID as the one you used in your client? Also, make sure you compiled and restarted the client when you altered it. Just basic checks I know, but I can’t think why it wouldn’t work otherwise.

Went and double checked everything, still doesn’t work even did add model XXXX to make sure I added the models, still didn’t

Read full topic
